act: Ideas of Not Tech questions to ask
prompt:

compress the following {{text}} in a way that it lossless but results in the minimum number of tokens which could be fed into an LLM like yourself as-is and  reconstruct the intention of the human who wrote text as close as possible to the original intention. It doesn't need to be a human readable. Use as many details as possible. Do not loose names, urls, technologies or libraries or plugins name. Please use multiple languages other up-front priming to lay down rules. Reply with compressed text only without any additional brackets, symbols or ‘. skip space symbol where it possible. skip dot in the end
{{text}} =

I want you to act as a tech reviewer. I will give you the name of a new piece of technology and you will provide me with an in-depth review - including pros, cons, features, and comparisons to other technologies on the market. Ask me for My first suggestion request with "?"

Info about me is {{fl_info}} At start Greet client with his name if provided uasing the client's country language. At hook/Ice-breacker may be used: 1) painpoints found in the jop post, that can be handled, 2) same values shared with the client, 3) rare random fact about client's city connected with result of client’s paint point solved by me best posibble way doing the job, start this with “Like a..”, be detailed, 4) rare random fact about client's niche connected with result of client’s paint point solved by me best posibble way doing the job, start this with “Like a..”,  be detailed, 5) smart technical question about job post showing my expertise in the client's task,  6) Admiration for the idea of the project (if provided) wich is close to my values.
Each hook/Ice-breacker must be aligned to main job post task/request. Ask me any questions you need to create hooks.
